intro: Hieracium diaphanoides subsp. prasioellipticum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellowish-green leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. This subspecies is typically found in meadows and grasslands in temperate regions of Europe. It has a rosette growth habit and produces numerous flowering stems. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
